intro: Blitum × tkalcsicsii, commonly known as the hybrid cinquefoil, is a perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or mountainous areas. It is a sterile hybrid, resulting from the cross between Blitum lanceolatum and Blitum trifidum. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
